content.user_title: Automate GitHub Actions workflows with AI agents
content.value_statement: Creating and maintaining CI/CD pipelines manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill coordinates specialized AI agents to design, implement, optimize, and debug GitHub Actions workflows in parallel.
actual_capabilities: Generate CI/CD pipelines from scratch using 5 specialized AI agents
Optimize existing workflows for faster execution and lower costs
Debug failing workflows with systematic root cause analysis
Implement security hardening and secrets management best practices
Design matrix testing strategies across multiple OS and runtime versions
Create reusable workflows and composite actions for organization-wide reuse
limitations: Requires external scripts (workflow-generator.sh, workflow-validator.sh) to be present
Depends on MCP tools from claude-flow package for agent orchestration
GitHub repository access and permissions required for actual workflow deployment
Cannot execute workflows locally without the act tool installed

output_examples.input: Create a CI/CD workflow for a Python project with pytest and Docker deployment
output: Generated workflow structure with lint, test, build, and deploy stages
Added pytest configuration with coverage reporting
Implemented Docker layer caching with buildx
Set up environment-specific deployments for staging and production

best_practices: Always pin GitHub Actions to specific commit SHAs instead of tags like @v1 or @latest
Use minimal permissions (GITHUB_TOKEN) and scope permissions at job level for least privilege
Implement caching strategies for dependencies, build artifacts, and Docker layers to reduce execution time
Add path filtering to skip workflow runs when only documentation or non-code files change
anti_patterns: Using @latest or @main for action versions (security and reproducibility risk)
Granting excessive permissions to GITHUB_TOKEN beyond what jobs require
Running all jobs serially when independent jobs could execute in parallel
Hardcoding secrets in workflow files instead of using GitHub Secrets

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the claude-flow MCP integration.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for GitHub Actions API calls?
faq.answer: GitHub API has a 5000 requests per hour limit for authenticated users. Use GITHUB_TOKEN for authenticated requests.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with existing GitHub Actions workflows?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes your existing .github/workflows/ files and suggests optimizations or creates parallel workflows.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads workflow files you explicitly provide. It does not access other repository data or secrets.

faq.question: Why is my workflow running slowly after optimization?
faq.answer: First runs may be slower due to cache misses. Subsequent runs should be faster. Check cache key specificity.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub's native workflow templates?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered customization, multi-agent coordination, and advanced patterns beyond basic templates.
